top_categories.workout_context: Chino Grinder’s high desert gravel, arizona grasslands demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Chino Grinder rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Chino Grinder’s arizona high desert gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Racing Chino Grinder isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Chino Grinder when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Chino Grinder. Make this intensity feel like home.
Chino Grinder’s arizona high desert gravel drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
Every session at Chino Grinder intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
The varied gradients at Chino Grinder reward climbing adaptability — knowing when to sit, when to stand, and when to switch.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Chino Grinder — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for Chino Grinder — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Chino Grinder’s arizona high desert gravel delivers on race day.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Chino Grinder’s 62 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Chino Grinder. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Chino Grinder requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on arizona high desert gravel to build confidence. Expect: high desert gravel, arizona grasslands, desert terrain.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, TT Threshold, and VO2max to prepare you for 62 miles of arizona high desert gravel in Chino Valley, Arizona.
